channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Not Joe Biden’s DNC: 6 takeaways so far. Plus, new COVID-19 vaccines on the way
item.description: Tim Walz stepped into the spotlight last night at the DNC giving the crowd a pep talk. Here are five other takeaways from the convention so far. And, new COVID-19 vaccines are on the way.
item.content:encoded:
Tim Walz stepped into the spotlight last night at the DNC giving the crowd a pep talk. Here are five other takeaways from the convention so far. And, new COVID-19 vaccines are on the way.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: National Women’s Soccer League and its players agree to a new contract deal
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Ali Krieger, former U.S. Women's National Team star, about the new collective bargaining agreement between players and the National Women's Soccer League.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Ali Krieger, former U.S. Women's National Team star, about the new collective bargaining agreement between players and the National Women's Soccer League.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Canadian company Alimentation Couche-Tard offers to buy the parent of 7-Eleven
item.description: The possibility of a Canadian company buying 7-Eleven is sure to attract the attention of the government, investors and consumers in Japan, where the convenience chain is a staple of everyday life.
item.content:encoded: The possibility of a Canadian company buying 7-Eleven is sure to attract the attention of the government, investors and consumers in Japan, where the convenience chain is a staple of everyday life.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Both major presidential campaigns indicate a desire to expand the child tax credit
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Joe Brusuelas, chief economist at accounting firm RSM US, about the economic plans of presidential candidates Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Joe Brusuelas, chief economist at accounting firm RSM US, about the economic plans of presidential candidates Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: All eyes at the DNC turn to Harris for her turn to address delegates
item.description: Democratic Vice President nominee Tim Walz introduced himself to the nation in a primetime address at the convention. Kamala Harris will give the convention's keynote address on Thursday night.
item.content:encoded: Democratic Vice President nominee Tim Walz introduced himself to the nation in a primetime address at the convention. Kamala Harris will give the convention's keynote address on Thursday night.
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Nearly 60% of baby foods in the U.S. don't meet nutritional guidelines, study says
item.description: Hundreds of products failed to reach adequate recommendations for macronutrients like protein and calories, but exceeded the recommended sugar content.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of products failed to reach adequate recommendations for macronutrients like protein and calories, but exceeded the recommended sugar content.

(Image credit: Raphael Satter)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Trump's remixed rallies try to change the tune from 'Crooked Joe' to 'Comrade Kamala'
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's rallies often resemble rock concerts, full of his greatest hits. But the former president has struggled to change his tune to run against Vice President Harris.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump's rallies often resemble rock concerts, full of his greatest hits. But the former president has struggled to change his tune to run against Vice President Harris.

(Image credit: Tierney L. Cross)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Investigating the story of a prominent Chinese dissent turned con artist
item.description: An example of how journalism sometimes works: a team investigates one story, one narrative, and if they keep an open mind and dig into the facts, they discover the real story is entirely different.
item.content:encoded: An example of how journalism sometimes works: a team investigates one story, one narrative, and if they keep an open mind and dig into the facts, they discover the real story is entirely different.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Climate change to get its moment in the sun at Democratic convention on Thursday
item.description: Climate change and energy policy is slated to be one of the topics that Democrats focus on as they make their pitch to mobilize the party for Vice President Kamala Harris.
item.content:encoded:
Climate change and energy policy is slated to be one of the topics that Democrats focus on as they make their pitch to mobilize the party for Vice President Kamala Harris.

(Image credit: Keren Carrión/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Most community college students plan to get 4-year degrees. Few actually do
item.description: Community college is often touted as an affordable start for students who want to earn bachelor’s degrees. But according to federal data, only 13% of students actually reach that goal.
item.content:encoded: Community college is often touted as an affordable start for students who want to earn bachelor’s degrees. But according to federal data, only 13% of students actually reach that goal.
item.dc:creator: Dylan Peers McCoy
